fullText: The show is a clever, meta-theatrical romp that pokes fun at Shakespeare and Broadway musicals with equal glee. It's packed with witty wordplay and energetic performances that keep the audience laughing.
dtliExcerpt: The show is a clever, meta-theatrical romp that pokes fun at Shakespeare and Broadway musicals with equal glee. It's packed with witty wordplay and energetic performances that keep the audience laughing.
bwwExcerpt: "Something Rotten!"...is fresh and hysterical and irreverent. It's easily the funniest thing to arrive on Broadway since "The Book of Mormon"...the song "A Musical," in which the writers get to goof on such shows as "Rent," ''Pippin," ''Les Miserables," ''On the Town," ''Annie" and the Rockettes. It's one of the highlights of a show that is full of them, all led by director Casey Nicholaw at his exuberant, daffy best...A stunningly good first act...invariably leads to a somewhat weaker second ac
